news.title: Trump accuses China of violating preliminary trade deal
news.summary: The U.S. and China in mid-May agreed to a 90-day suspension on most tariffs after Trump slapped sky-high tariffs on the big trade partner.

news.title: Inflation rate slipped to 2.1% in April, lower than expected, Fed’s preferred gauge shows
news.summary: The personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to show a 2.2% annual rate in April. The personal consumption expenditure price index is a measure of inflation in the U.S.

news.title: Caviar and privacy: Airlines' business-class wars are here
news.summary: American and United are revamping their international business class. The two airlines will be flying from New York to London and from London to Paris. American and United will also be flying to Paris and Madrid.

news.title: U.S. foreign tax bill sends jitters across Wall Street
news.summary: Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill Act," if enshrined into law, could transform the current trade conflict into a capital war, investment banks say.

news.title: As EVs stumble, automakers are bringing back a kind of hybrid that promises long range
news.summary: Extended range hybrid electric vehicle auto came and went with models like the Chevy Volt and BMW i3. But it may be poised for a comeback.

news.title: Nvidia needs to show investors the future. Its CEO is sure he’s found the answer.
news.summary: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, talks about the company's future. He says AI and robots are part of our daily lives, and Nvidia plays a key role.

news.title: Airbnb’s stock is now a sell, as a weak summer for leisure travel looms, analyst says
news.summary: Analysts cut price targets across the U.S. hotel sector. Expectations dip on wavering consumer confidence and a drop in inbound international travel.

news.title: Inflation rate slows again and almost hits Fed’s 2% goal, but trade wars could spoil the party
news.summary: The cost of living barely rose in April. The rate of inflation slowed even closer to prepandemic levels. It's unclear whether the recent progress can be sustained as the trade wars drag on.

news.title: United CEO says budget airlines ‘screw the customer’ — but apparently new partner JetBlue is an exception
news.summary: Kirby was speaking at WSJ’s Future of Everything festival. Kirby: “Newark is safe” in the wake of outages and cancellations.

news.title: Consumer spending softened as tariffs kicked in. Anxious Americans saved more in April.
news.summary: Trade wars weigh on household spending in U.S. Household spending up 0.3% in July, down 0.4% in year-to-date.
